data.title: Gautier - Meaning of the Name Gautier - What Does the French Name Gautier mean?
data.meta_description: The meaning, origin and history of the name Gautier
data.text:
Gautier

The Meaning & Origin of the Name Gautier

Gautier is a French boy name, which has 7 letters.

Gautier is a French name derived from the Germanic name Walter, meaning "ruler of the army". This name has been used since medieval times and is a popular surname in France.

Log in to save this name to your favorites.

Detailed Information About The Name Gautier

The name Gautier is of French origin and is derived from the Germanic name "Waltari," meaning "ruler of the army." It is a surname that has been passed down through generations and can also be used as a given name. Gautier has a rich history in France, and it has grown in popularity since the Middle Ages. The name has been associated with various notable figures, particularly in the fields of literature and art.

One of the most famous bearers of the name Gautier is Théophile Gautier (1811-1872), a prominent French poet, novelist, and art critic. He was a central figure in the Romantic movement and made significant contributions to literature. Gautier's works often explored exotic themes, and he was known for his vivid and descriptive writing style. His most well-known works include "Mademoiselle de Maupin" and "Emaux et Camées."

The name Gautier has also influenced the world of fashion. Known as Paul Gautier, Jean-Paul Gautier (born 1952) is a renowned French fashion designer. He has been a major force in the industry and is famous for his avant-garde designs, incorporating elements of street style and traditional couture. Gautier's fashion house has been at the forefront of many groundbreaking fashion trends, and he is known for his inclusive approach towards gender and diversity.

Today, the name Gautier continues to be used as both a first name and a surname in France. It carries a sense of artistic and literary heritage and pride. Its distinct origin and associations make it an intriguing choice for those seeking a name with depth and cultural significance.
